summary: This document is an email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding the arrest and initial court proceedings for Ghislaine Maxwell. It discusses logistical arrangements for a video conference presentment in the District of New Hampshire following her arrest that morning.

persons.name: Christian Everdell
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating with other defense counsel and prosecutors regarding her arrest and court proceedings.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C., discussing inability to appear pro hac vice and requesting to listen to proceedings.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, mentioned as needing email invitation for video conference and not being admitted to practice in District of New Hampshire.

persons.name: Mark S. Cohen
persons.context: Defense attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, coordinating with other defense counsel regarding the arrest and court proceedings.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Client of the defense attorneys, arrested by the FBI in Bradford, New Hampshire, and subject of the SDNY indictment.

persons.name: Larry Vogelman
persons.context: Local counsel who will be appearing for Ghislaine Maxwell at the presentment in the District of New Hampshire.

connections.description: Everdell is part of the defense team representing Maxwell following her arrest.
Pagliuca is part of the defense team representing Maxwell, though not admitted in New Hampshire.
Menninger is part of the defense team representing Maxwell.
Cohen is part of the defense team representing Maxwell.
Vogelman is identified as local counsel who will appear for Maxwell at the presentment.
Co-defense attorneys coordinating on the Maxwell case, communicating about calls and proceedings.
Both are defense attorneys for Maxwell mentioned together regarding admission issues.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: FBI arrested Ghislaine Maxwell in Bradford, New Hampshire, based on an SDNY indictment.

events.title: Remote Presentment Proceedings
events.description: Planned video conference presentment for Ghislaine Maxwell in the District of New Hampshire in the afternoon following her arrest.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested by the FBI on July 2, 2020, in Bradford, New Hampshire.
The arrest was based on an indictment from the Southern District of New York (SDNY) that was being unsealed.
Defense attorneys Christian Everdell, Jeff Pagliuca, Laura Menninger, and Mark S. Cohen were notified and began coordinating for her defense.
Local counsel Larry Vogelman was arranged to appear for Maxwell at the presentment in the District of New Hampshire.
The presentment was scheduled to occur via remote video conference on the same afternoon as the arrest.
